meanings.definition: a mapping between two algebraic varieties that preserves the group structure
meanings.sent1: The isogenies connected the different algebraic shapes.
meanings.sent2: Mathematicians study isogenies to understand group structures.
meanings.sent3: The isogenies decided to throw a party for the algebraic shapes.
meanings.sent4: The isogenies acted as bridges between the algebraic worlds.
meanings.sent5: The concept of isogenies made the algebraic varieties easier to grasp.

meanings.definition: a type of mathematical function that is used in number theory and algebraic geometry
meanings.sent1: Number theory involves exploring the properties of isogenies.
meanings.sent2: Algebraic geometry uses isogenies to analyze shapes and patterns.
meanings.sent3: The isogenies were the stars of the math party, solving complex equations.
meanings.sent4: In the world of math, isogenies are like secret codes waiting to be cracked.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of isogenies lies in their ability to connect different mathematical concepts.
